dbms.diskspacemanager

Class DiskSpaceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbms.diskspacemanager.DiskSpaceManager

  • public class DiskSpaceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Database component that manages the disk space. This component allows the other DBMS components to do the following:
    • Create a file.
    • Destroy a file.
    • Allocate pages to a file.
    • Deallocate pages from a file.
    • Read a page from the database.
    • Write a page to the database.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • instance

        private static final DiskSpaceManager instance

      • directory

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,File> directory
        The directory of files. This object keeps track of all files in the database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiskSpaceManager

        private DiskSpaceManager()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DiskSpaceManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        The only instance of the DiskSpaceManager during runtime.

      • createFile

        public void createFile(java.lang.String filename,
              int numPages)
        Add a new file to the database, with a specified number of pages. Overwrites the file if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file.
        numPages - The desired number of pages that will be allocated for the file.

      • eraseFile

        public boolean eraseFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Removes a file from the database.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file.
        Returns:
        true if the file is deleted from the database. false if the file does not exist.

      • allocatePages

        public int allocatePages(java.lang.String filename,
                int numPages)
                  throws DBFileException
        Allocates a set of pages for a file in the database. Pages are always allocated at the end of the file for simplicity.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file where the pages will be allocated.
        numPages - The number of pages that will be allocated.
        Returns:
        The page number of the first page that is allocated.
        Throws:
        DBFileException - If numPages is not positive.

      • deallocatePages

        public void deallocatePages(java.lang.String filename,
                   int startPageNum,
                   int numPages)
                     throws DBFileException,
                            BadPageNumberException
        Deallocates a set of pages from a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file where the pages will be deallocated.
        startPageNum - The page number of the first page that will be deallocated
        numPages - The number of pages of that will be deallocated.
        Throws:
        DBFileException - If numPages is not positive.
        BadPageNumberException - If startPageNum is not illegal.

      • writePage

        public void writePage(java.lang.String filename,
             int pageNum,
             Page page)
               throws BadFileException,
                      BadPageNumberException,
                      DBFileException
        Writes the contents of the specified page to disk.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file containing the page.
        pageNum - The number of the page.
        page - The contents of the page.
        Throws:
        BadFileException - If the file is not in the database.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page number if not in the file.
        DBFileException - If the file does not contain any pages.

      • readPage

        public void readPage(java.lang.String filename,
            int pageNum,
            Page page)
              throws BadFileException,
                     BadPageNumberException,
                     DBFileException
        Copies the contents of the specified page from disk into the Page provided.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file containing the page that will be copied.
        pageNum - The page number of the page that will be copied.
        page - The page object where the contents will be copied.
        Throws:
        BadFileException - If the file does not exist.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page number is not in the file.
        DBFileException - If the file does not contain any pages.

      • listFiles

        public void listFiles()
        Lists the files in the database. This is only used for testing purposes.
